prvtRingEpsMib.name: prvtRingEpsMib

revisions.description: Added raps monitoring methods for rings and subrings
Added ring ID for rings and subrings
Added descriptions for rings and subrings
Added prvtRingEpsWaitToBlockTimer, changed values order for PrvtRingEpsPortStatusType

prvtRingEpsMib.contactinfo: BATM/Telco Systems Support team Email: For North America: techsupport@telco.com For North Europe: support@batm.de, info@batm.de For the rest of the world: techsupport@telco.com
prvtRingEpsMib.description: This private MIB provides capability of controlling the automatic Ring Ethernet Protection Switching (ITU-T G.8032)

PrvtRingEpsModeType.name: PrvtRingEpsModeType
PrvtRingEpsModeType.description: Version of the protocol the instance will use

PrvtRingEpsStateType.name: PrvtRingEpsStateType
PrvtRingEpsStateType.description: State of the R-APS request processing logic

PrvtRingEpsLocalCommandType.name: PrvtRingEpsLocalCommandType
PrvtRingEpsLocalCommandType.description: Local system state given by the top priority command received

PrvtRingEpsRemoteRequestType.name: PrvtRingEpsRemoteRequestType
PrvtRingEpsRemoteRequestType.description: Remote command received via RAPS packets

PrvtRingEpsNodeRoleType.name: PrvtRingEpsNodeRoleType
PrvtRingEpsNodeRoleType.description: Role of the defined node inside the protected ring

PrvtRingEpsRplPortType.name: PrvtRingEpsRplPortType
PrvtRingEpsRplPortType.description: Ring port designated as RPL (only valid if prvtRingEpsNodeRole is rapsNrRplOwner or rapsNrRplNeighborNode

PrvtRingEpsDefectType.name: PrvtRingEpsDefectType
PrvtRingEpsDefectType.description: Ring port designated as RPL (only valid if prvtRingEpsNodeRole is rapsNrRplOwner or rapsNrRplNeighborNode

PrvtRingEpsPeerStatusType.name: PrvtRingEpsPeerStatusType
PrvtRingEpsPeerStatusType.description: Status bits set in the received RAPS packet. The meanings are: bRplBlocked(0) The RPL link is blocked by the RPL owner. bDoNotFlush(1) RAPS sender requests that we do don flush our FDB. bBlockedPortReference(2) The port that is blocked by the sender of the RAPS packet.

prvtRingEpsInstanceTable.name: prvtRingEpsInstanceTable
prvtRingEpsInstanceTable.description: This table includes information about the ring instances defined on this node.

prvtRingEpsMode.name: prvtRingEpsMode
prvtRingEpsMode.description: Version of the protocol the instance will use

prvtRingEpsNodeRole.name: prvtRingEpsNodeRole
prvtRingEpsNodeRole.description: This variable identifies the role that the node will play inside the ring. The node can have two special roles, RPL owner or RPL neighbor, when one of its ports is designated as RPL. The ring can have a single RPL owner and a single RPL neighbor, connected between eachother via the RPL. If neither of the node ports are designated as RPL, then the node should have the role of a Simple node

prvtRingEpsState.name: prvtRingEpsState
prvtRingEpsState.description: This variable identifies the state of the ring node according to the standard state machine.

prvtRingEpsLocalCommand.name: prvtRingEpsLocalCommand
prvtRingEpsLocalCommand.description: The user can control the ring using a set of commands allowing blocking and unblocking of ports. These commands are rapsLcManualSwitch, rapsLcForcedSwitch and rapsLcClear. The others are either read-only values or not yet defined by the standard.

prvtRingEpsControlVlan.name: prvtRingEpsControlVlan
prvtRingEpsControlVlan.description: The vlan ID used for RAPS & CFM traffic.

prvtRingEpsPort0Ifindex.name: prvtRingEpsPort0Ifindex
prvtRingEpsPort0Ifindex.description: This variable is the interface index of the interface either a bridge port, or an aggregated IEEE 802.1 link within a bridge port, attached to the ring as port 0.

prvtRingEpsPort1Ifindex.name: prvtRingEpsPort1Ifindex
prvtRingEpsPort1Ifindex.description: This variable is the interface index of the interface either a bridge port, or an aggregated IEEE 802.1 link within a bridge port, attached to the ring as port 1.

prvtRingEpsRplPort.name: prvtRingEpsRplPort
prvtRingEpsRplPort.description: This object controls whether the one of the ring ports is designated as RPL for the ring or not.

prvtRingEpsManualSwitchPort.name: prvtRingEpsManualSwitchPort
prvtRingEpsManualSwitchPort.description: The port blocked by the Manual Switch command

prvtRingEpsCfmMdLevel.name: prvtRingEpsCfmMdLevel
prvtRingEpsCfmMdLevel.description: Value of the CFM MD level where the protected domain is situated

prvtRingEpsPort0Mep.name: prvtRingEpsPort0Mep
prvtRingEpsPort0Mep.description: This variable is the peer MEP ID that should send CCMs towards port 0.

prvtRingEpsPort1Mep.name: prvtRingEpsPort1Mep
prvtRingEpsPort1Mep.description: This variable is the peer MEP ID that should send CCMs towards port 1.

prvtRingEpsRevertive.name: prvtRingEpsRevertive
prvtRingEpsRevertive.description: This is the MI_RAPS_Revertive variable defined in the standard. It controls whether the RPL is blocked again after a failure of some ring link recovers.

prvtRingEpsNoVirtualChannel.name: prvtRingEpsNoVirtualChannel
prvtRingEpsNoVirtualChannel.description: Node is part of a subring that doesn't use RAPS virtual channel

prvtRingEpsHoldOffTimer.name: prvtRingEpsHoldOffTimer
prvtRingEpsHoldOffTimer.description: Range is from 0 to 10 seconds in 100msec intervals

prvtRingEpsGuardTimer.name: prvtRingEpsGuardTimer
prvtRingEpsGuardTimer.description: Range is from 10msec to 2 seconds in 10msec intervals

prvtRingEpsWaitToBlockTimer.name: prvtRingEpsWaitToBlockTimer
prvtRingEpsWaitToBlockTimer.description: Range is from 5010msec to 7 seconds in 10msec intervals. This time is actulally the Guard Timer + 5 seconds

prvtRingEpsDefectFop.name: prvtRingEpsDefectFop
prvtRingEpsDefectFop.description: So far only the situation when two or more RPL-owners are defined in the ring is identified as a defect. This scenario is noticed when the instance with the RPL-Owner role receives a RAPS packet with the RB bit set in its status field from a different NodeID than its own.

prvtRingEpsPort0Status.name: prvtRingEpsPort0Status
prvtRingEpsPort0Status.description: This variable reflects the state of port 0. It can be either Ok (unblocked), Blocked or Failed.

prvtRingEpsPort1Status.name: prvtRingEpsPort1Status
prvtRingEpsPort1Status.description: This variable reflects the state of port 1. It can be either Ok (unblocked), Blocked or Failed.

prvtRingEpsPort0PeerNodeId.name: prvtRingEpsPort0PeerNodeId
prvtRingEpsPort0PeerNodeId.description: This variable reflects the Node ID from the RAPS packet received via port 0.

prvtRingEpsPort1PeerNodeId.name: prvtRingEpsPort1PeerNodeId
prvtRingEpsPort1PeerNodeId.description: This variable reflects the Node ID from the RAPS packet received via port 1.

prvtRingEpsPort0PeerCommand.name: prvtRingEpsPort0PeerCommand
prvtRingEpsPort0PeerCommand.description: This variable reflects the Request/State of the RAPS packet received via port 0.

prvtRingEpsPort1PeerCommand.name: prvtRingEpsPort1PeerCommand
prvtRingEpsPort1PeerCommand.description: This variable reflects the Request/State of the RAPS packet received via port 1.

prvtRingEpsPort0PeerStatus.name: prvtRingEpsPort0PeerStatus
prvtRingEpsPort0PeerStatus.description: This variable reflects the status field of the RAPS packet received via port 0.

prvtRingEpsPort1PeerStatus.name: prvtRingEpsPort1PeerStatus
prvtRingEpsPort1PeerStatus.description: This variable reflects the status field of the RAPS packet received via port 1.

prvtRingEpsOperationalStatus.name: prvtRingEpsOperationalStatus
prvtRingEpsOperationalStatus.description: The purpose of this status is to identify to the user whether this instance is ready for running. The operational status can be up or down. When creating the instance the operational status will be down. Receiving CCMs from the expected peer MEPs on both ring ports will bring the operational status to up. If any needed CFM configuration is removed the operational status will go back to down

prvtRingEpsForcedSwitchPort.name: prvtRingEpsForcedSwitchPort
prvtRingEpsForcedSwitchPort.description: The port blocked by the Forced Switch command

prvtRingEpsRingId.name: prvtRingEpsRingId
prvtRingEpsRingId.description: The last octet of the RAPS destination MAC address is designated as Ring ID (01-19-A7-00-00-[Ring ID]). As of G.8032v2 the destination MAC address '01-19-A7-00-00-01' is used. The usage of other MAC addresses is for further study.

prvtRingEpsPort0MonitoringMethod.name: prvtRingEpsPort0MonitoringMethod
prvtRingEpsPort0MonitoringMethod.description: Raps monitoring methods for port 0: ccm - CCM messages and link status will be used for raps monitoring, link-status -Link status will be used for raps monitoring

prvtRingEpsPort1MonitoringMethod.name: prvtRingEpsPort1MonitoringMethod
prvtRingEpsPort1MonitoringMethod.description: Raps monitoring methods for port 1: ccm - CCM messages and link status will be used for raps monitoring, link-status - Link status will be used for raps monitoring

prvtRingEpsVlanTable.name: prvtRingEpsVlanTable
prvtRingEpsVlanTable.description: This table includes information about protected vlans and the ring instances that monitor them.

prvtRingEpsVlanEntry.name: prvtRingEpsVlanEntry
prvtRingEpsVlanEntry.description: Connection between vlan IDs and the RAPS instance that monitors them

prvtRingEpsInstance.name: prvtRingEpsInstance
prvtRingEpsInstance.description: RAPS instance that will monitor this vlan

prvtRingEpsSubRingTable.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingTable
prvtRingEpsSubRingTable.description: Table containing information about the subring instances defined on this node.

prvtRingEpsSubRingEntry.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingEntry
prvtRingEpsSubRingEntry.description: Configuration of a subring that is interconnected to the main ring in an interconnection node

prvtRingEpsSubRingNodeRole.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingNodeRole
prvtRingEpsSubRingNodeRole.description: This variable identifies the role that the node will play inside the subring. The node can have two special roles, RPL owner or RPL neighbor, when the subring port is designated as RPL. The subring can have a single RPL owner and a single RPL neighbor, connected between eachother via the RPL. If the subring port is not designated as RPL, then the node should have the role of a Simple node

prvtRingEpsSubRingState.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingState
prvtRingEpsSubRingState.description: This variable identifies the state of the subring node according to the standard state machine.

prvtRingEpsSubRingLocalCommand.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingLocalCommand
prvtRingEpsSubRingLocalCommand.description: The user can control the ring using a set of commands allowing blocking and unblocking of ports. These commands are rapsLcManualSwitch, rapsLcForcedSwitch and rapsLcClear. The others are either read-only values or not yet defined by the standard.

prvtRingEpsSubRingPortIfindex.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingPortIfindex
prvtRingEpsSubRingPortIfindex.description: This variable is the interface index of the interface either a bridge port, or an aggregated IEEE 802.1 link within a bridge port, attached to the subring.

prvtRingEpsSubRingPortMep.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingPortMep
prvtRingEpsSubRingPortMep.description: This variable is the peer MEP ID that should send CCMs towards the subring port.

prvtRingEpsSubRingRplPort.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingRplPort
prvtRingEpsSubRingRplPort.description: This object controls whether the subring port is designated as RPL for the subring or not.

prvtRingEpsSubRingVirtualChannelVlan.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingVirtualChannelVlan
prvtRingEpsSubRingVirtualChannelVlan.description: The vlan ID used for Virtual Channel encapsulation

prvtRingEpsSubRingRevertive.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingRevertive
prvtRingEpsSubRingRevertive.description: This is the MI_RAPS_Revertive variable defined in the standard. It controls whether the RPL is blocked again after a failure of some subring link recovers.

prvtRingEpsSubRingHoldOffTimer.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingHoldOffTimer
prvtRingEpsSubRingHoldOffTimer.description: Range is from 0 to 10 seconds in 100msec intervals

prvtRingEpsSubRingGuardTimer.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingGuardTimer
prvtRingEpsSubRingGuardTimer.description: Range is from 10msec to 2 seconds in 10msec intervals

prvtRingEpsSubRingWaitToBlockTimer.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingWaitToBlockTimer
prvtRingEpsSubRingWaitToBlockTimer.description: Range is from 5010msec to 7 seconds in 10msec intervals. This time is actulally the Guard Timer + 5 seconds

prvtRingEpsSubRingDefectFop.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingDefectFop
prvtRingEpsSubRingDefectFop.description: So far only the situation when two or more RPL-owners are defined in the ring is identified as a defect. This scenario is noticed when the instance with the RPL-Owner role receives a RAPS packet with the RB bit set in its status field from a different NodeID than its own.

prvtRingEpsSubRingPortStatus.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingPortStatus
prvtRingEpsSubRingPortStatus.description: This variable reflects the state of the subring port. It can be either Ok (unblocked), Blocked or Failed.

prvtRingEpsSubRingPortPeerNodeId.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingPortPeerNodeId
prvtRingEpsSubRingPortPeerNodeId.description: This variable reflects the Node ID from the RAPS packet received via the subring port.

prvtRingEpsSubRingPeerCommand.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingPeerCommand
prvtRingEpsSubRingPeerCommand.description: This variable reflects the Request/State of the RAPS packet received via the subring port.

prvtRingEpsSubRingPeerStatus.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingPeerStatus
prvtRingEpsSubRingPeerStatus.description: This variable reflects the status field of the RAPS packet received via the subring port.

prvtRingEpsSubRingVcPeerNodeId.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingVcPeerNodeId
prvtRingEpsSubRingVcPeerNodeId.description: This variable reflects the Node ID from the RAPS packet received via the virtual channel.

prvtRingEpsSubRingVcPeerCommand.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingVcPeerCommand
prvtRingEpsSubRingVcPeerCommand.description: This variable reflects the Request/State of the RAPS packet received via the virtual channel.

prvtRingEpsSubRingVcPeerStatus.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingVcPeerStatus
prvtRingEpsSubRingVcPeerStatus.description: This variable reflects the status field of the RAPS packet received via the virtual channel.

prvtRingEpsSubRingPropagateTC.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingPropagateTC
prvtRingEpsSubRingPropagateTC.description: This is the MI_RAPS_Propagate_TC variable mentioned in the standard. If this is enabled a flush in the subring will be followed by a flush in the main instance.

prvtRingEpsSubRingOperationalStatus.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingOperationalStatus
prvtRingEpsSubRingOperationalStatus.description: The purpose of this status is to identify to the user whether this instance is ready for running. The operational status can be up or down. When creating the instance the operational status will be down. Receiving CCMs from the expected peer MEP on the subring port will bring the operational status to up. If any needed CFM configuration is removed the operational status will go back to down

prvtRingEpsSubRingAdminStatus.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingAdminStatus
prvtRingEpsSubRingAdminStatus.description: Administrative status of the subring instance

prvtRingEpsSubRingControlVlan.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingControlVlan
prvtRingEpsSubRingControlVlan.description: The vlan ID used for RAPS & CFM traffic.

prvtRingEpsSubRingRingId.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingRingId
prvtRingEpsSubRingRingId.description: The last octet of the RAPS destination MAC address is designated as Ring ID (01-19-A7-00-00-[Ring ID]). As of G.8032v2 the destination MAC address '01-19-A7-00-00-01' is used. The usage of other MAC addresses is for further study.

prvtRingEpsSubRingMonitoringMethod.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingMonitoringMethod
prvtRingEpsSubRingMonitoringMethod.description: Raps monitoring methods for subring port: ccm - CCM messags and link status will be used for raps monitoring, link-status -Link status will be used for raps monitoring

prvtRingEpsDefectAlarm.name: prvtRingEpsDefectAlarm
prvtRingEpsDefectAlarm.description: This trap will be sent by any instance when it notices a defect. So far only the situation when two or more RPL-owners are defined in the ring is identified as a defect. This scenario is noticed when the instance with the RPL-Owner role receives a RAPS packet with the RB bit set in its status field from a different NodeID than its own. The management entity receiving the notification can identify the system from the network source address of the notification, and can identify the instance reporting the change by the indices in the OID of the prvtRingEpsDefectFop variable in the notification.

prvtRingEpsSwitchoverAlarm.name: prvtRingEpsSwitchoverAlarm
prvtRingEpsSwitchoverAlarm.description: This trap will be sent by any instance when it changes state. The management entity receiving the notification can identify the system from the network source address of the notification, and can identify the instance reporting the change by the indices in the OID of the prvtRingEpsState variable in the notification.

prvtRingEpsSubRingDefectAlarm.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingDefectAlarm
prvtRingEpsSubRingDefectAlarm.description: This trap will be sent by any subring instance when it notices a defect. So far only the situation when two or more RPL-owners are defined in the ring is identified as a defect. This scenario is noticed when the instance with the RPL-Owner role receives a RAPS packet with the RB bit set in its status field from a different NodeID than its own. The management entity receiving the notification can identify the system from the network source address of the notification, and can identify the instance reporting the change by the indices in the OID of the prvtRingEpsDefectFop variable in the notification.

prvtRingEpsSubRingSwitchoverAlarm.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingSwitchoverAlarm
prvtRingEpsSubRingSwitchoverAlarm.description: This trap will be sent by any subring instance when it changes state. The management entity receiving the notification can identify the system from the network source address of the notification, and can identify the instance reporting the change by the indices in the OID of the prvtRingEpsSubRingState variable in the notification.

prvtRingEpsGroup.name: prvtRingEpsGroup
prvtRingEpsGroup.description: Objects for the RAPS instances group.

prvtRingEpsVlanGroup.name: prvtRingEpsVlanGroup
prvtRingEpsVlanGroup.description: Objects for the RAPS monitored vlans group.

prvtRingEpsSubRingGroup.name: prvtRingEpsSubRingGroup
prvtRingEpsSubRingGroup.description: Objects for the RAPS subring group.

prvtRingEpsCompliance.name: prvtRingEpsCompliance
prvtRingEpsCompliance.description: The compliance statement for support of the Ring EPS MIB module.
